text: Tap. Clear light copper body with a small wispy white head. The nose is slightly sweet crystal malt and a touch of graininess with some minimal hops. The flavor is much the same, a lot sweeter than I would prefer, though on the finish theres a bit of a hop bitterness bite that helps out a little. Light to medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Meh, not a whole lot to write home about, I think Id opt for an Anchor Steam if it were a choice.
On draft at Caliente during RBSG 2016.. Pours yellow with a white head. Nose of lemon and fruit. Medium body. Flavor same as aroma. Finishes with light bitterness. Pretty good.
Draft - pours amber white head - nose/taste of toast, steam malt and bready caramel - medium body
Draft pour. The beer is a clear copper with a white head of foam. Doughy and a little fruity. Medium body and medium carbonation.
On tap at Caliente. Pours a hazy yellow gold with small white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is grass, lemon zest, citrus. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, light finish, ok.
Draft - Light sweet grains and a touch of spice. Clear gold with a decent white head. Light spicy grains. Weird.
Dampled at Caliente. Clear gold with a little amber. Mild melony zst bitterness. Some earth and grain. Fruit.
Draft at the source. Clear golden yellow color. Aroma of cheerios. Taste is lightly bitter toast. Nice.
Nice even hops that are heavy upfront and then mellow out. Pineapple scent and citrus enriches this beverage. Full mouth for the hops like ipa style. A little hazy and yellow orange color. Tap

Draft at Whole Foods PM. Pours hazy straw with off-white head. Nose was pale malt, hops, pineapple. Tasted rich, smooth, with a fairly complex finish. Methinks this beer is mis-categorized, or else it is a very hoppy CC. I truly dont give a shit either way, but I want the purists to lose some sleep. Cheers.
